newsitem.title: BULGARIA: BULGARIA 1996 INFLATION SEEN AROUND 288 PERCENT.
newsitem.headline: BULGARIA 1996 INFLATION SEEN AROUND 288 PERCENT.

text.p: Bulgaria's monthly consumer price inflation for December is expected to accelerate to around 20 percent, a National Statistics Institute official said, giving cumulative annual inflation of about 288 percent.
The official, who declined to be named, told Reuters the monthly increase from 9.7 percent in November was due to rising energy prices.
"The sharp fall of the lev against the dollar in November and December boosts the prices of fuels, electricity and imported goods," the official said.
If monthly inflation for December hits 25 percent, cumulative annual inflation will reach 304.5 percent.
The institute said on Tuesday cumulative inflation for the first 11 months was 223.6 percent.
The lev fell to around 365 per dollar on November 29 from 245 at the beginning of the month. It traded around 530 on Tuesday.

The government raised petrol prices again on Monday by an average of 21 percent and diesel fuel prices by 26 percent, after increases of an average 10 percent and nine percent respectively on November 28.
Fuel prices have risen by some 420 percent from January through November while electricity prices have increased 411 percent during the same period.
